intro: Psychotria guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and plays a role in local ecosystems. However, it is not widely cultivated or utilized for commercial purposes.
